intro: Centrogenium, commonly known as the plantain lily, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Iridaceae. It consists of several species native to southern Africa, characterized by their showy, often fragrant flowers. The plants typically have strap-shaped leaves and produce strikingly colored blooms in shades of yellow, orange, and red. Centrogenium species are often cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. They thrive in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade conditions.
